statements: SELECT * FROM customer_orders ORDER BY purchase_date DESC
SELECT customer_id, accessory_name FROM customer_orders WHERE customer_id = 100
SELECT accessory_name, purchase_date FROM customer_orders WHERE accessory_name LIKE '%earphones%'
SELECT * FROM customer_orders WHERE purchase_date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-12-31'
SELECT customer_id, COUNT(order_id) AS order_count FROM customer_orders GROUP BY customer_id HAVING order_count > 1
SELECT * FROM customer_orders ORDER BY purchase_date DESC, customer_id ASC
SELECT customer_id, accessory_name FROM customer_orders WHERE purchase_date > '2021-01-01'
SELECT accessory_name FROM customer_orders WHERE customer_id = 1002
SELECT customer_id, accessory_name, purchase_date FROM customer_orders WHERE purchase_date BETWEEN '2021-01-01' AND '2021-12-31' ORDER BY customer_id DESC
SELECT DISTINCT customer_id FROM customer_orders
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%';
SELECT * FROM orders ORDER BY total_amount DESC;
SELECT customer_name, total_amount FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT order_id, order_date, total_amount FROM orders WHERE customer_id = 2;
SELECT * FROM customers INNER JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id;
SELECT customer_name AS Name, order_date AS Date FROM customers JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id WHERE total_amount > 100;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, count(order_id) AS total_orders FROM customers LEFT JOIN orders ON customers.customer_id = orders.customer_id GROUP BY customer_id, customer_name;
SELECT customer_name, customer_email FROM customers
SELECT customer_id, customer_name, customer_email FROM customers
SELECT * FROM accessories WHERE price > 50
SELECT accessory_name, price FROM accessories ORDER BY price DESC
SELECT order_id, order_date, total_amount FROM orders ORDER BY order_date ASC
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1
SELECT * FROM orders o JOIN customers c ON o.customer_id = c.customer_id ORDER BY order_date DESC
SELECT customer_id, SUM(total_amount) AS total_spent FROM orders GROUP BY customer_id ORDER BY total_spent DESC
SELECT accessory_name, price FROM accessories WHERE price > 50
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE customer_name LIKE 'A%'
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT customer_id, customer_name FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT customer_name, total_amount FROM Customers JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id;
SELECT product_name, price FROM Products WHERE price > 50;
SELECT * FROM Customers;
SELECT customer_name, address FROM Customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT Orders.order_id, Orders.total_amount, Customers.customer_name FROM Orders INNER JOIN Customers ON Orders.customer_id = Customers.customer_id;
SELECT Products.product_name, Products.price, OrderDetails.quantity FROM Products INNER JOIN OrderDetails ON Products.product_id = OrderDetails.product_id;
SELECT customer_name, order_date FROM Customers JOIN Orders ON Customers.customer_id = Orders.customer_id;
SELECT * FROM customers;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;
SELECT order_id, order_date FROM orders ORDER BY order_date DESC;
SELECT name, price FROM products WHERE price > 50.00;
SELECT * FROM order_items WHERE quantity >= 5;
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY name DESC;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 3;

SELECT p.name AS product_name, o.order_date AS order_date, oi.quantity AS quantity FROM products p JOIN order_items oi ON p.product_id = oi.product_id JOIN orders o ON oi.order_id = o.order_id WHERE p.price > 100 ORDER BY o.order_date DESC;
SELECT c.name AS customer_name, SUM(p.amount) AS total_payments FROM customers c JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id JOIN payments p ON o.order_id = p.order_id GROUP BY c.name;
SELECT c.name AS customer_name, COUNT(o.order_id) AS total_orders FROM customers c LEFT JOIN orders o ON c.customer_id = o.customer_id GROUP BY c.name ORDER BY total_orders DESC;
